definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: It's no wonder that Taiwan's diplomatic allies can almost be counted on one hand.
sentences.chinese: 難怪臺灣的邦交國一直以來都屈指可數。

sentences.english: In the practice of it, Mr Fukuda père opened diplomatic relations with China.
sentences.chinese: 基於此福田赳夫政府實現了與中國恢復邦交。

sentences.english: The press saw the event as a straw in the wind that augured the resumption of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 報界把這件事看作是兩國之間即將恢復邦交的預兆。

sentences.english: Diplomacy had much function in each development process of various states.
sentences.chinese: 邦交在各諸侯國的發展過程中起着非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: A friendly intercourse is opened between the most remote parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 遠的兩國開始了一種親睦的邦交。

sentences.english: China and Laos did not normalize ties until 1988.
sentences.chinese: 中國和老撾直到1988年才恢復邦交正常化。

sentences.english: This year marks the 35th anniversary of normalization of China-Japan diplomatic ties.
sentences.chinese: 今年恰逢中日邦交正常化35週年。

sentences.english: The current target demographics to promote the spread of local education are our diplomatic allies in Latin America.
sentences.chinese: 目前目標爲中南美洲的邦交國，促進當地教育普及。

sentences.english: In the early 1970s, the focus was on rapprochement.
sentences.chinese: 1970年代初期的重點是恢復邦交。

sentences.english: Saint Lucia became Taiwan's 25th diplomatic ally.
sentences.chinese: 聖露西亞成爲臺灣第二十五個邦交國。

definition: having trading relations (of nations or regions)
Shikoku (one of the four main islands of Japan)
